results.title: Etoiles 2: Ici Paris
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Sensible Films and Luis Espana
results.brief_description: This second instalment of the ‘Etoiles’ series uses a pacy magazine style to take the viewer around Paris and its most original and quirky aspects. Far from concentrating on the usual monuments and landmarks, this series attach itself to the lifestyles of 12-14 year old people living in Paris, the variety of their experiences and ethnic background. The programme is intended to be used by second year French students and above. It contains 5 episodes on 13 minutes each (approx.) Includes guide with transcripts of each episode and additional activities.

results.title: Ethnic broadcasting
results.creator_credit: Tom Manefield, Linda Blagg and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
Shows how a group of Greek women and men started their own radio program motivated by pride and interest in their own ethnic origins and an awareness of the cultural deprivation of Greek migrants in Adelaide.

results.title: Ethiopian mosaic
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Desmond Dew and Hugh O'Connor
results.brief_description: An engrossing blend of scenes in the ancient kingdom of Ethiopia where indolent camels still sway through the sand and long-robed tribesmen race their Arabian steeds, while great airliners glide into a modern airport. Produced without commentary, this film seems to put the viewer in the midst of the crowds of smiling people, among whom is glimpsed the emperor himself, Haile Selassie, Lion of Judah.

results.title: Ethiopia advances
results.brief_description: An account of the work of the Food and Agriculture Organisation of the United Nations in helping Ethiopia make best use of her fertile land. FAO experts’ recommendations included the use of labour saving farm implements; importation of new seeds to improve local crop; the setting up of an experimental seed growing station; the vaccination of Zebu cattle against Rinderpest.

results.title: Ethics in the computer age
results.brief_description: Examines the loss of revenue suffered by the designers and producers of computer software caused by the pirating of video games. The focus is on the theft of “intellectual property” by people using computers in their homes. It also explains the dangers of hackers accessing sensitive information and the potentially life-endangering results of tampering with that information.

results.title: Ethics and the Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journalism Resource Tapes”.
Creighton Burns, Editor of the Age and Harry Gordon, former Editor in Chief of the Herald and Weekly Times, discuss issues relating to journalism’s code of ethics. They discuss what their in-house rules are relating to ethics and integrity within their journalistic world.

results.title: Eternity and a day = Mia Eoniotita ke mia mira
results.creator_credit: Phoebe Economopoulos, Greek Film Centre, Greek Television, Paradis Films, Intermedias, La Sept Cinema and Theo Angelopoulos
results.brief_description: Bruno Ganz plays Alexander, a famous author reaching the end of his life. On the eve of going into hospital he encounters a young Albanian refugee boy who is one of the thousands of illegal immigrants from Eastern Europe coming into Greece. Alexander begins a quest to return the boy home, and when that proves impossible, attempts to give the young orphan the security and opportunities unavailable on the streets. All the while his thoughts take him back into the past, where he attempts to make amends for his, at times, indifferent treatment of his wife, his child, and his mother. The voyage of the poet and the young boy culminates in a magical bus ride through Balkan history where Alexander comes to understand both the futility of one individual’s acts in affecting history, as well as finally understanding the true worth of a poet’s words. Angelopoulos’ languid and mesmerising mise-en-scene, combined with his passion for a cinema of intellectual commitment, has made him one of Europe’s premier contemporary artists of the transcendant. Features a beautiful score by Eleni Karaindrou. “Eternity and a Day” won the Palme d’Or at the 1998 Cannes Film Festival.

results.title: Eternity
results.creator_credit: Susan MacKinnon, Vivid Pictures and Lawrence Johnston
results.brief_description: For forty years in one city a word appears written on the street. It could have been any word in any city of the world, but this word was ‘Eternity’. Always the same, written in chalk in elegant copperplate script, appearing like frost overnight on the streets of Sydney. In 1956 the writer was discovered after twenty years of secrecy. He would continue to write this word until his death in 1967. Director Lawrence Johnston’s internationally award-winning documentary is an orchestration of beautiful black and white cinematography combined with haunting music. Biographical reconstruction succeeds in including the audience amongst those whose lives have been touched by Arthur Stace’s lonely and mysterious mission.

results.title: Eternal Youth
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Beyond 2000”.
Everybody wants it, and many have searched for it. “Beyond 2000” explores the growth of the life prolonging industry and the study of gerontology. It’s a penetrating look at a topic dear to each and everyone of us - life!

results.title: Eternal sunshine of the spotless mind
results.creator_credit: Focus Features, Steve Golin, Anthony Bregman and Michel Gondry
results.brief_description: Joel (Jim Carrey) and Clementine’s (Kate Winslet) relationship isn’t going too well so she engages a psychiatrist to employ a process whereby Joel and the relationship is erased from her memory. On finding out about the procedure Joel thinks he’ll do the same but the couple actually re-discover more about the start of their relationship and what brought them together in the first place. In a quirky look at relationships, break-ups and a kind of love-conquers-all mystique this romantic/black comedy stems from the same key team that put together “Human Nature” - director Michel Gondry and writer Charlie Kaufman. Cast includes Kirsten Dunst, Mark Ruffalo, Elijah Wood, Tom Wilkinson.
